care.watering: Water when top inch of soil feels dry. Usually once per week. Pothos prefers slightly moist soil but not waterlogged.
care.sunlight: Bright, indirect light is ideal. Tolerates low light but growth slows and variegation may fade. Avoid direct sun which can scorch leaves.
care.pruning: Prune regularly to encourage bushier growth. Cut just above a leaf node. Propagate cuttings in water. Remove yellow or dead leaves anytime.

troubleshooting.symptoms: Older leaves turning yellow and dropping. Soil feels constantly wet.
troubleshooting.solution: Overwatering is the main cause. Let soil dry out more between waterings. Ensure pot has drainage holes. Yellow leaves can also indicate natural aging on older growth.

troubleshooting.symptoms: Leaf edges and tips turning brown and crispy. Leaves may curl.
troubleshooting.solution: Underwatering, low humidity, or chemical buildup from tap water. Water more consistently, increase humidity, or switch to filtered water. Trim brown tips with clean scissors.

troubleshooting.symptoms: Leaves drooping and looking sad. Vines losing their perk.
troubleshooting.solution: If soil is dry: Water thoroughly until it drains from bottom. If soil is wet: Overwatering or root rot. Reduce watering and check roots for health.

troubleshooting.symptoms: Black, brown, or yellow spots on leaves. May be surrounded by yellow halos.
troubleshooting.solution: Bacterial or fungal leaf spot from overwatering or poor air circulation. Remove affected leaves, avoid wetting foliage, improve ventilation, and reduce watering.

troubleshooting.symptoms: Sticky leaves, tiny bugs, or webbing visible on plant. Leaves may become damaged.
troubleshooting.solution: Common pests include spider mites, mealybugs, and scale. Spray with insecticidal soap or neem oil. Wipe leaves clean. Isolate from other plants and repeat treatment weekly.

faqs.q: How often should I water my Pothos?
faqs.a: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry to the touch, typically once per week. Pothos is forgiving but prefers consistent moisture without being waterlogged.

faqs.q: Why is my Pothos losing its variegation?
faqs.a: Insufficient light causes variegated Pothos to revert to solid green. Move to a brighter location with indirect light to maintain color patterns.

faqs.q: Can I grow Pothos in water permanently?
faqs.a: Yes! Pothos can grow in water indefinitely. Change water weekly and add liquid fertilizer monthly for best results.
